Description: Pottery vase made of coarse straw tempered Nile silt, with pointed base, rounded, bag shaped body, short neck with raised flaring rim, coated with micaceous wash or self-slip.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p.24; pl. xxx.94b, reproduced as Rough ware R94s in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Marked H114 on side.
